brick.definition: Includes any products that can be described/observed as a quantity of frozen, pre-mixed dough, batter or powder that is specifically intended to produce bread, cakes, biscuits, desserts, or other products. Products may be ready to use (where no additional ingredients need to be added to the mix prior to use) or require the addition of wet ingredients such as water, milk, oil, fat or egg. These products must be frozen to extend their consumable life.
brick.definitionExcludes: Excludes products such as Soups, Perishable or Shelf-Stable Baking Mixes, all Part Baked and Baked Products.

attType.definition: Indicates, with reference to the product branding, labelling or packaging, whether the product makes a claim to be suitable for consumption by consumers who have diabetes.

attValue.definition: This term is used to describe those product attributes that are unidentifiable given existing or available product information.

attType.definition: Indicates, with reference to the product branding, labelling or packaging the descriptive term that is used by the product manufacturer to identify the presence of an industry recognized "organic" certification upon the product labelling or packaging.

attValue.definition: This term is used to describe those product attributes that are unidentifiable given existing or available product information.

attType.definition: Indicates, with reference to the product branding, labelling or packaging, the descriptive term that is used by the product manufacturer to identify the method of preparing the baking/cooking mix.

attValue.definition: This term is used to describe those product attributes that are unable to be classified within their specific market; e.g. goat's cheese - goat's cheeses is often generically labelled and cannot be further classified.
This term is used to describe those product attributes that are unidentifiable given existing or available product information.

attType.definition: Indicates, with reference to the product branding, labelling or packaging, the descriptive term that is used by the product manufacturer to identify whether or not the product requires additional ingredients.

attValue.definition: This term is used to describe those product attributes that are unidentifiable given existing or available product information.

attType.definition: Indicates, with reference to the product branding, labelling or packaging, the descriptive term that is used by the product manufacturer to identify whether the product is suitable for Vegetarians and/or Vegans.

attValue.definition: This term is used to describe those product attributes that are unidentifiable given existing or available product information.

attType.definition: Indicates, with reference to the product branding, labelling or packaging, the descriptive term that is used by the product manufacturer to identify the type of baking/cooking mix.

attValue.definition: This term is used to describe those product attributes that are unable to be classified within their specific market; e.g. goat's cheese - goat's cheeses is often generically labelled and cannot be further classified.
This term is used to describe those product attributes that are unidentifiable given existing or available product information.
